title: The Case Against Theism - Refuting the Resurrection Argument
description: I discuss the argument for the resurrection of Jesus, arguing that even when  assuming a maximal set of facts about God and the gospels, naturalistic explanations still account for the evidence far better than the resurrection hypothesis. I discuss a range of evidence from psychology, sociology, and comparative religion, arguing that the resurrection appearances were the result of bereavement hallucinations and collective ecstatic religious experiences, combined with memory distortions and cognitive dissonance. I also discuss explanations for the empty tomb, and highlight problems with the traditional Christian explanation that Jesus was resurrection to vindicate his divine mission to humanity.

title: A Message for William Lane Craig (and other apologists)
description:
My details
Email: Fods12@gmail.com
Website: https://jamesfodor.com/
Podcast: https://www.thescienceofeverything.net/

title: Responding to Criticisms of Effective Altruism
description:
Matt and I discuss several prominent criticisms of effective altruism, and why we think they fail. We consider the claim that EA is trivial, is dependent on utilitarianism, ignores systemic change, is too focused on longtermism, and serves only to make billionaires feel better about themselves. 

Video we reviewed:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jvpGdoKTK_I

title: Reviewing David Pallman on the Resurrection and RHBS
description:
Here I watch and respond to David Pallman's criticisms of my RHBS model for explaining the facts relating to Jesus' death and subsequent appearances.

description: I reflect on my recent discussion with David Pallmann about substance dualism, and articulate my views on the modal argument, though experiments, conceivability, and realisation physicalism.

title: Substance Dualism or Physicalism? A Discussion with David Pallmann
description:
I discuss philosophy of mind with David, focusing on his recent video series defending substance dualism and my critique of his arguments. We discuss the knowledge argument, the modal argument, and the interaction problem.

David's original video: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mP8bGgLOpnk
James' response videos:

title: Gary Habermas is still talking about the Resurrection of Jesus
description:
I review a recent video in which Habermas talks with Sean McDowell about Near Death Experiences, the Shroud of Turin, cognitive dissonance, and the resurrection of Jesus.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KC3-Sn5SBr4&

title: Is Materialism Destroying America? A Materialist Responds
description:
I respond to this video critiquing materialism by Sean McDowell.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=00Hoq1CQd-g&

Topics include moral anti-realism, legal positivism, Judeo-Christian values, and how to assess philosophical arguments.

title: A Critique of Substance Dualism Part 2 - Responding to @faithbecauseofreason8381 ‚Äã
description:
A critique of David Pallmann's (Faith Because of Reason) responses to arguments against substance dualism, including the pairing problem, the interaction problem, and the causal closure objection, and find that he fails to present a coherent, explanatory alternative to physicalism about the mind.

Link to part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9COVx5pwQUw

title: A Critique of Substance Dualism Part 1 - Responding to @faithbecauseofreason8381
description:
A comprehensive critique of David Pallmann's (Faith Because of Reason) defense of substance dualism. I discuss the argument from the nature of the self, the argument from introspection, the modal argument, and the knowledge argument, and find them all unconvincing. 

Original Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mP8bGgLOpnk

title: Consciousness, brain preservation, and the end of death
description:
An interview with Ariel Zeleznikow-Johnston, author of the book 'The Future Loves You: How and Why We Should Abolish Death'. We begin by discussing how best to define death, focusing on the idea of death as the permanent disruption of psychological identity, and how such identity is constituted by our personality, desires, and memories. We then consider the science of brain preservation, including the recently-developed technique of Aldehyde-Stabilized Cryopreservation, and how it could be used to indefinitely preserve the brain structure that encodes or personal identity. Ariel argues that such a preserved brain could potentially be used to construct a digital simulation of our brains, essentially allowing us to survive the biological death of our bodies. We conclude by considering some potential challenges of implementign such a technology, and whether it would achieve widespread social acceptance.

Ariel's book:
https://www.amazon.com/Future-Loves-You-author/dp/0241655897

More on brain preservation:
https://www.brainpreservation.org/how-much-protein-structure-loss-is-there-following-glutaraldehyde-crosslinking/
https://www.brainpreservation.org/large-mammal-announcement/

Mapping the Drosophila brain:
https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.add9330

title: Is Darwinian Evolution a fact? - Subboor Ahmad Vs Dave Farina
description:
Debate Title: Is Darwinian Evolution a Fact?  
Hosted by James Fodor
- 20 min introduction - SA  
- 20 min introduction - DF  
- 10 min rebuttal - SA  
- 10 min rebuttal - DF  
- 30 min open discussion  
- 2 min summary - SA  
- 2 min summary - DF

title: Debate Debrief for 'Is Darwinian Evolution a Fact?'
description:
I debrief and discuss the debate between Subboor Ahmad and Dave Farina about Darwinian evolution. I analyse the debating stratagies and key arguments of both, and consider the encounter from a scientific, philosophical, and social lens.
I also struggle to get through all of chat's messages!

My debate with Subboor from 6 years ago:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V_WeGUHHaao

title: Reviewing Apologetics Content while Sick so I can Feel Worse (it worked)
description:
I review this video with 56 minutes entirely devoid of BIG insights from engaging skeptics.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYfYisiRtLw

title: Why do Atheists Debate Christians? Helping Inspiring Philosophy Understand Atheism
description: I respond to a recent post by Inspiring Philosophy in which he argues atheists should not have any reason to deconvert Christians. I show how many thesits don't understand atheism.

title: Have Christian Apologists Just Given Up? Religious Fan-Fiction Replaces Actual Argumentation
description:
I review two videos by Sean McDowell. 
An interview with Wikipedia Co-Founder Larry Sanger discussing his converstion to Christianity https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t7H8qZBw9_A.
An interview with Rob Bowman discussing biblical evidence for the divinity of Jesus https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72LX8_zwiVw.
I show how in both cases there is no real attempt to provide arguments or evidence. Instead they merely tell us stories about what they believe and how it makes sense to them. I call this engaging in 'religious fan fiction'.

title: The Case Against Theism - A Fine-Tuning Argument for Naturalism
description:
I develop a novel critique of the fine-tuning argument for the existence of God, arguing that if we consider the range of possible types of minds that God might have reason to create, we find that the vast majority are not possible in a physical universe. Hence the existence of a universe with fine-tuned constants is actually evidence against theism.

This is a followup to my previous video on fine-tuning: https://youtu.be/QJBNtnRywK0

title: Why Science Reveals a God-less Universe
description:
Here I review a recent video by Sean McDowell interviewing Spencer Klavan, who argues that science and specifically quantum physics points to a universe ordained by God.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-gHic1q-0qg

Gofundme set up by Nathan:
https://www.gofundme.com/f/james-fodor-to-create-awesome-science-philosophy-content?

title: Answering Braxton's Five Questions for Atheists in 2025
description: Responding to this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gsma6UT3rwk&

title: Discussion about Fine-Tuning with Apologetics Squared (for real this time)
description: I discuss the fine-tuning argument with Apologetics Squared. We consider the objection of alternative forms of life and alternative laws of nature, then discuss aspects of divine psychology such as why God would create anything and why he wouldn't create a non-physical universe.

title: Reviewing Capturing Christianity on Prophecy, Incarnation, and the Trinity
description:
I review two videos by Capturing Christianity, talking about prophecy, the trinity, whether God could have a body, and criticisms of Mormonism.

Original videos:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RyT_ARildtU&
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c3hxJetp8iw&

title: Rewiewing McDowell and Shermer on Morality
description: I review this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=73Q0WtfS-A4&

title: What makes a good prophecy?: Responding to more Christian Apologetics nonense
description:
Here I review a recent video by Capturing Christianity in which he argues that certain prophecies made by Joseph Smith and Mohammed are proof they are not genuine prophets. I argue that Cameron misrepresentations the views of Mormons and Muslims, and also repeatedly applies standards which would by equally problematic for mainstream Christianity if applied consistently.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lsD8BXG0Vr4

title: Cosmic Fine-Tuning Discussion with Robin Collins
description: Here I discuss fine-tuning with Dr Robin Collins. We consider various aspects including the possibility of exotic forms of life, how to think about the 'epistemically-accessible region' of possible constants, and how to deal with the problem of 'old evidence'. We spend a lot of time on the issue of the topological structure of parameter space, discussing my claim that apparent local fine-tuning is consistent with the absence of global fine-tuning. We conclude with a brief discussion of God's reasons for creation and other theological matters.

title: The Fine-Tuning Argument Discussion: James vs Otangelo
description:
Otangelo joins me to discuss the fine-tuning argument. We discuss how fine-tuning is defined, the relationship between constants and laws, the role of hypothetical alternatives and inferences, and when it is appropriate to infer design.

Otangelo's website: https://reasonandscience.catsboard.com/
Otangelo's book: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0D6KV6WGF

title: Cameron asked about miracle claims. I answered.
description: I respond to some questions from @CapturingChristianityabout evidence, God, and miracle claims.

title: Is Cosmic Fine-Tuning a good argument for Theism?
description: I discuss the fine-tuning argument with Matthew from @deliberationunderidealcond5105. We consider the possibility of different laws of nature and how we should assess the simplicity and predictibility of different possible laws. We also discuss Conway's Game of Life and its relevance for assessing how 'fine-tuned' laws need to be go generate complexity. We conclude by discussing how effective Theism is in explaining fine-tuning, considering issues like how to infer agency and the extent to which we can appeal to background beliefs to predict divine actions.

title: An Atheist Battles the Demonic Hordes from Capturing Christianity
description:
Reviewing more demon nonsense from Capturing Christianity.
We discuss why God allows demonic posession, techniques used to diagnose demonic possession, how demons possess people, and the quality of the evidence for demonic activity.

title: The Case Against Theism - Refuting the Fine-Tuning Argument
description: The fine-tuning argument is one of the most popular arguments for theism, based on the observation that the constants of nature appear 'fine-tuned' to within a narrow range that enables life to exist. In this video I argue that the fine-tuning argument fails for three reasons. First, the argument unjustifiably focuses exclusively on constants while ignoring the equations that give relevance to those constants. Second, we do not know what possible conditions life could exist in if the constants of nature were different. Third, apologists have failed to provide clear and convincing reasons why god would be likely to fine-tune a universe for embodied life. I show how apologetic responses are undermined by lack of imagination and double-standards, rendering the fine-tuning argument an unconvincing argument for theism.

title: Are Universities too Woke? Bad Apologetics
description: Stream of the recent Bad Apologetics stream I did with Nathan. We dicussed the issue of 'wokeness', focusing on universities. We analysed current usage of the term 'woke', and taking about some of the political and ideological ramifications of the term, including its ideological connection to ideas from critical theory and recent co-option by conservative pundits.

title: Philosophy, Critical Thinking, and Misinformation Talk
description:
I discuss how we can use tools and ideas from philosophy to combat misinformation and help promote critical thinking. In particular I focus on how and when appeals to authority are appropriate and how we can better justify appeals to scientific expertise. I also discuss ways to engage with people with differing worldviews, with a focus on using holistic worldview comparisons and helping the interlocutor to integrate new information into their worldview without feeling threatened.

This talk was originally delivered via zoom to the Atheist Society of Victoria in March 2024.

title: Is Psychophysical Harmony a good argument for Theism?
description: I discuss the argument from psychophysical harmony with Matthew from @deliberationunderidealcond5105. We discuss the meaning of 'psychophysical harmony', whether it can be accounted for under naturalism, and how effectively it can be explained under theism. You can read Matthews blog post on the subject here: https://benthams.substack.com/p/for-theism-part-1.

title: More Terrifying Demonic Nonsense that Destroys My Sanity
description:
Another day, another review of a Capturing Christianity demons video.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gBJaZ4I55NY

title: Progressive Christianity, Conservative Christianity, and the Christian Right
description: My friend Matthew, a minister-in-training, and I discuss the intellectual and political history surrounding progressive and conservative approaches to Christian thought and belief, including their theological differences and the implications this has on modern politics.

title: More Near-Death Delusions and Christian Nonsense
description:
I review another Capturing Christianity video on near death experiences and the 'evidence' for an afterlife.
Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_z7XyqaKSPc&

title: Car Chat 6: On the mind and dualism
description:
On a long drive I review a recent interview of J.P Moreland by Sean McDowell, in which they discuss arguments in favour of substance dualism and against materialism about the mind. I give responses relating to theories of brain/mind identity theory, the intuitive obviousness of dualism, the continuity of the self, and the reality of free willl.

Link to video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lb7Dg0mJOww&

title: Let's review some more Capturing Christianity Cringe
description:
I review a recent video by Capturing Christianity respond to @rationalityrules about Christianity and the problem of evil. We also take a detour discussing epistemology and the status of philosophy more generally.

Link to original video:
https://youtu.be/8EmFg4vd95k

title: Chatting with Nathan about Philosophy and AI
description: Nathan and I talk about Artificial Intelligence, the recent progress in Large Language Models, cognitive science, philosophy of mind, and whether there is any point in philosophy at all.

title: Reviewing Capturing Christianity on AI and Consciousness
description:
I review a discussion between Cameron and Eric about consciousness, AI, and the soul. We discuss arguments about invertible qualia, continuity of self over time, the Chinese room argument, the binding problem, how consciousness could emerge from non-conscious elements, and the interaction problem.



Link to original video:
https://youtu.be/t82R594lqQQ

title: Capturing Christianity's Dangerous Demonic Delusions (it never stops...)
description: I review yet another video in which Cameron continues peddling his embaressing nonsense about demonic posession.

title: Why Theism can't Explain Anything - Reviewing another Capturing Christianity Video
description:
Here I review this video:
https://youtu.be/k6BEA1yiut8
I discuss the explanatory merits of theism vs naturalism.

title: Reviewing POWERFUL New Evidence for a Zombie Jesus
description:
Here I review a video from Sean McDowell, discussing 7 'new' pieces of evidence for the resurreciotn of Jesus. I show how all these evidences really come down to appealing to the Bible, arguments from personal incredulity, and wishful thinking. In the process I discuss biblical interpretation, how to assess ancient texts, psychological and sociological effects leading to belief formation, formation of new religious movements, and how to assess the resurrection as an explanation.

Link to original video?
https://youtu.be/-G9R4ZJXVp4

title: Unreasonable Faith Audiobook - Chapter Two: the Kalam Cosmological Argument Part 3
description:
A reading of the third section of chapter 2 of my book 'Unreasonable Faith', with additional analysis and commentary. This section covers Craig's arguments that the universe must have had a cause, and that the cause must have been personal. In it I discuss the possibility of an uncaused universe, the nature of agent causation, potential candidates for a cause of the universe, and the plausibility of substance dualism.

Link to my book on Amazon:
https://www.amazon.com/Unreasonable-Faith-William-Overstates-Christianity/dp/1912701189/

title: Car Chat 5: Counter-Apologetics, the Incarnation, and Atonement
description: Here I advocate for a greater focus by atheists and agnostics on internal problems and tensions within Christian theology. I argue that it is important to emphasise the explanatory inadequecies within the Christian view, and highlight two examples for initial discussion: the Incarnation and the Atonement. I argue that existing theories to explain these doctrines are inadequate, and as such both of these teachings pose significant problems for the plausibility of Christianity.

title: Car Chat 4: Defending Objective Morality from Subjectivist Snowflakes
description: A discussion of further aspects of metaethics, with a focus on normativity and competing theories of reasons.

title: Car Chat 3: Let's Ground Morality without God
description: Here I discuss some aspects of metaethics, normativity, and grounding of morality, comparing naturalistic and theistic approaches.

title: A Cavalcade of Crazy Christian Claptrap
description:
In this video I discuss some recent community posts from @CapturingChristianity, and then review a video by @InspiringPhilosophy about the meagre moral fruits argument.

Link to original video: https://youtu.be/EzkqeQt2e4U

title: Unreasonable Faith Audiobook - Chapter Two: the Kalam Cosmological Argument Part 2
description:
A reading of the second section of chapter 2 of my book 'Unreasonable Faith', with additional analysis and commentary. This section covers Craig's argument that the universe must have a beginning a finite time in the past. I discuss the argument against the possibility of an actual infinite, the argument against the possibility of forming an infinite through successive addition, and the alleged empirical evidence for the beginning of the universe.

Link to my book on Amazon:
https://www.amazon.com/Unreasonable-Faith-William-Overstates-Christianity/dp/1912701189/

title: Unreasonable Faith Audiobook - Chapter Two: the Kalam Cosmological Argument Part 1
description:
A reading of the first section of chapter 2 of my book 'Unreasonable Faith', with additional analysis and commentary. This section covers the discussion of the philosophy of time, and Craig's defence of the tensed theory of time.

Link to my book on Amazon:
https://www.amazon.com/Unreasonable-Faith-William-Overstates-Christianity/dp/1912701189/

title: Somehow, the Minimal Facts Argument Got Worse
description:
Here I review a recent video in which Gary Habermas and Mike Licona provide commentary and answer questions about the minimal facts argument for the resurrection of Jesus. I argue that their approach is flawed, and they fail to provide any substantial reasons for thinking the resurrection is the best explanation for their alleged set of minimal facts.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KVCiiuvnQlM&

title: Let's Review CosmicSkeptic vs. Counsel of Trent Because Why Not
description:
A review of a discussion between Cosmic Skeptic and Counsel of Trent, covering topics like the problem of evil and morality.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dFYrfKHSV2k&ab_channel=CapturingChristianity

title: YET MORE Apologetics Nonsense about Fine-Tuning
description:
0:00:00 Leslie Wickman
1:08:45 Philip Goff

I review two Capturing Christianity videos talking about fine-tuning. I discuss evaluating hypotheses, whether the multiverse explanation commits the inverse gambler's fallacy, and the abuse of science for ideological purposes.

Dr. Leslie Wickman interview:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DzPATGVsykw

Dr. Philip Goff interview:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IZZp_Q3If7o

title: Let's Review some Capturing Christianity: The Resurrection and Apologetics Culture
description:
Here I review some recent videos and posts from Cameron's channel, looking at how he 'exposes the intellectual side of Christian belief'. I then review a recent interview with Lydia McGrew, discussing the weaknesses of a minimal facts approach for the resurrection. Turns our here Lydia and I have a lot of common ground...

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RFZvZha2OvU

title: Discussing the Digital Physics Argument with Johanan Raatz
description:
Here I chat with Johanan Raatz about his digital physics argument for God. We talked about emergent spacetime, quantum cognition, theories of consciousness, qualia and the binding problem, and whether materialism or some kind of fundamental mentality are better theories of reality.

Johanan's channel:
https://www.youtube.com/user/JohananRaatz

Emergent spacetime:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Induced_gravity

Quantum cognition:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_cognition

IIT theory of consciousness:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_information_theory

Xenon nuclear spin paper:
https://pubs.asahq.org/anesthesiology/article/129/2/271/17992/Nuclear-Spin-Attenuates-the-Anesthetic-Potency-of

The binding problem:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binding_problem

title: Car Chat 2: Design Arguments, Morality, and Maths Advice
description: A casual chat where I share some thoughts on design arguments, how to discuss meta-ethics and morality, and answer a question about studying mathematics.

title: Car Chat 1: God, Minds, and Explanation
description: Here I share some recent thoughts about the nature of minds in the context of the idea of God as a disembodied mind. I argue that we cannot use our folk theory or scientific theory of minds to describe God's mind, and hence we cannot rely on analogies which appeal to human purposive action to justify arguments involving God's purposive action. I also relate this to the issue of explanatory power, and argue that divine explantions simply restate the data to be explained, without adding providing any understanding.

title: Is Fine-Tuning Actually a Good Argument for God?
description:
In this video I respond to criticism of my argument against fine-tuning from Adherent Apologetics and Apologetics Squared.

Original video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7-79HLCjfLE

title: Discussion with PF Jung on Jordan Peterson and 'Postmodern-Neomarxism'
description:
I chat with PF Jung about some of my objections to Jordan Peterson, particularly his views on religion and atheism, as well as his use of the term 'Postmodern-Neomarxism'. We also touch on some general issues of political ideology and the 'culture war' in the US.

Link to his channel:
https://www.youtube.com/c/PFJung

Originally recorded 3rd April 2022

title: The State of Apologetics
description:
An experimental stream where I chat about philosophy and apologetics as I drive.
Topics covered include the moral argument, free will, the purpose of apologetics arguments, and comparative explanatory power.

00:00 Setting up and being dumb
02:40 Start of chat
07:50 Audio improves

title: The Resurrection is Still a Bad Explanation
description:
Here I respond to Trent Horn's argument for the resurrection as presented in his debate with Pinecreek.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLXgbvyUHo8

title: More Bad Theist Arguments about Consciousness  - Buckle up!
description:
Here I review a recent interview between Cameron (Capturing Christianity) and Josh Rasmussen about consciousness and materialism. Josh presents some of his ideas about why the fundamental nature of consciousness and the mind provides a major problem for materialism, and points to the existence of mind as fundamental. I critique their arguments and provide critical commentary on these issues.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6hZh0JEz8hU&

title: Discussion with Matthew on Meta-ethics and God
description:
Here I discuss meta-ethics with Matthew from Deliberation Under Ideal Conditions. We mostly focus on naturalist versus non-naturalist theories of morality, and the relationship between rationality and morality. We also briefly discuss Effective Altruism and issues about peer disagreement and theism.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OeO-6AlhrnE

title: Here's what Craig will say about the Kalam Documentary...
description:
Here I provide a reaction to and review of the Kalam documentary recently posted by skydivephil. As well as offering my own thoughts, I will also try to predict what Craig's responses will be.

Link to original video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pGKe6YzHiME

title: Let's review some more Capturing Christianity...(it was bad)
description: I review several of Cameron's more recent videos, including some short memes, an argument from biology (the origin of life), and Cameron discussion the 'surprising link' between doubt and anxiety.

title: 3 Sincere Answers for Cameron - Evidence for Atheism
description:
Responding to Cameron's questions for atheists. In particular, I discuss some of the reasons why I believe that there is no God, including the lack of explanatory power of theism, the problem of suffering, the problem of divine hiddenness, and meagre moral fruits of belief, and how God is poorly defined.

Link to original video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=89tcsb2aPLI

title: The Urgent Case for Jesus - A Discussion with the Greg Sheridan
description: Here I interview journalist Greg Sheridan and discuss his most recent book "Christians: The Urgent Case for Jesus in Our World", in which he argues for the truth and ongoing cultural importance of Christian teachings and practises.

title: Coherentism vs Foundationalism Epistemology Debate James Fodor vs David Pallman
description:
David Pallman and I discuss our respective views on epistemology. Epistemology is the branch of philosophy which examines the basis for knowledge and methods of acquiring knowledge. In this conversation, David defends a version of internalist foundationalism, while James defends a version of weak coherentism.

Originally recorded August 2021.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzK-8-zWvlU

title: God Explains Nothing about Consciousness
description:
I respond to Braxton's recent sermon about consciousness and the mind.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-fjeIwgFVvU

title: Classical Theism vs Naturalism - Canadian Catholic vs James Fodor
description:
In this video I discuss various aspects of Theism and Naturalism with Canadian Catholic. Our discussion focuses mainly on the cosmological argument and philosophy of causation.

Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kVPcH2pN4ZI&

title: Was Jesus Resurrected? Robert Martin vs James Fodor Debate
description:
A debate between James Fodor and Robert Martin (Melbourne City Bible Forum) concerning the facts surrounding Jesus' death, crucifixion, and reported appearances.

Originally recorded in Melbourne, March 2016.
Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=67BGpzQ1hWg

A casual chat after the resurrection debate with Caleb Jackson on Cerebral Faith.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MUBTLaV3YAo

title: The Problem of Evil - James Fodor vs Adi Purusha
description:
Adi Purusha and I discuss the problem of evil; the question of whether the extent and scope of evil and suffering in the world is evidence against the existence of an all-loving, all-powerful God.

Originally recorded in Feb 2021
Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OgWbavi-388

title: The Evolutionary Argument Against Naturalism - James Fodor vs Maverick Christian
description:
In this video I debate Maverick Christian about the merits of his argument Evolutionary Against Naturalism. According to this argument, if Naturalism is true it cannot rationally be believed because of the undercutting defeater that evolution doesn't select for beliefs, only behaviours, so if naturalism is true we can't trust our beliefs, including our belief that naturalism is true.

Link to Maverick Christian's paper on his version of the argument:
https://www.academia.edu/37338576/A_Mental_States_Approach_to_the_Evolutionary_Argument_Against_Naturalism_Draft_

Originally recorded Sept 2021.
Link to original video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JAsd8knUh_w

title: Does Maths Prove God? Alexey Burov vs James Fodor
description:
Here I debate with physicist Alexey Burov about his 'Pythagorean Argument for Grand Design', which is based on a special character of physical laws, associated with their appropriateness for human life and for discoverability.

Originally recorded in July 2021. 
Link to original: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=refULOwez7E

title: More Responses to Craig on Causation and the Universe
description:
I respond to two videos, both relating to the metaphysics of causation, the origin of the universe, and Craig's Kalam Cosmological Argument.

First video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3GvDu1_3f8k

Second video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmWgdUAivsM&ab_channel=PastorKyleBailey

title: Chatting about the Evolutionary Argument Against Naturalism
description:
In this stream I chat with a listener V about Plantinga's Evolutionary Argument Against Naturalism. We focus on his arguments in favour of the Defeater Thesis, the various thought experiments Plantinga offer in favour of this premise, and ways of responding to these thought experiments. In the process we discuss the meaning of 'cognitive reliability', semantic epiphenominalism, and the status of thought experiments.

Link to argument summary:
https://www.maverick-christian.org/2013/05/evolutionary-argument-against-naturalism.html

title: Reviewing the William Lane Craig & Scott Clifton on Discussion the Kalam
description:

title: How Inspiring Philosophy Misrepresents Science
description:
In this video I provide further analysis of the claims that Inspiring Philosophy has made concerning the theological implications of various results from quantum mechanics and cosmology. I argue that he misrepresents key experimental and theoretical results in his videos, providing a highly misleading picture of the extent to which the findings of physics support his worldview.

This discussion is a follow up to my debate with IP on his Digital Physics Argument. 
https://youtu.be/b2HZu6BcxHU

title: 500 Arguments Against Christianity
description:
Nathan and I outline 500 arguments against Christianity, all in premise-conclusion form. The purpose of this video is 1) to show how silly it is to focus on quantity rather than the quality of arguments, and 2) to showcase a variety of arguments against Christianity, some of which will be stronger than others.

Link to the slides (with corrections!):
https://fods12.wordpress.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/500-arguments-against-christianity.pptx

Filipe Leon's list of arguments for atheism:
http://exapologist.blogspot.com/2019/09/sixty-arguments-for-atheism.html

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qi7ANgO2ZBU

description:
Here I provide a critical response to a recent video by Capturing Christianity and Joel Schmidt discussing what they consider to be the top 3 biggest mistakes made by atheists (particularly atheists on YouTube). This includes a discussion of lacktheism, the notion of extraordinary evidence, the value of philosophy vs science, and whether there is any evidence for the existence of God.

title: How Capturing Christianity Misrepresents the History of Science
description:
I respond to a video from Capturing Christianity, in which Cameron interviews Tom McLeish and Dave Hutchings about the history of science, arguing that science arose from a Christian context and only makes sense with Christian philosophical foundations. I argue that they misrepresent the history of science to further an apologetic purpose, and show how in fact science has no need of a theological underpinning, nor was one central to its origin.



00:00 Introduction
02:40 When did science begin?
11:30 The experimental method
19:15 Universal laws of nature
28:00 The mechanical philosophy
47:25 Doubting Thomas and faith
58:00 Christian attitudes to science
1:05:20 Christian foundations to science?

1:27:10 Science in non-Christian cultures
1:59:00 Marginalising science
2:03:00 Cherry-picking history
2:13:25 Summary and conclusions


The two books I recommended are:

Science & Religion: A Historical Introduction
https://www.amazon.com/Science-Religion-Introduction-Gary-Ferngren/dp/0801870380/

Philosophy of Science: The Central Issues
https://www.amazon.com/Philosophy-Science-Central-Issues-Second/dp/039391903X

title: Is Life Meaningful Without God: Theist vs Atheist Debate Part 1 - Opening Remarks
description: This is the first part of a debate which took place at the University of Sydney on 31st of March, 2021. I debated Muslim scholar Uthman Badar on the topic 'Is Life Meaningful Without God?' I defended a view of meaning adapted from Susan Wolf in her paper 'Meaningfulness: A Third Dimension of the Good Life'. The discussion focused mostly on the nature of value and meaning in a material world, and how to understand these concepts. The event was hosted by Sydney University Muslim Students' Association (SUMSA).

title: Is Life Meaningful Without God: Theist vs Atheist Debate Part 2 - Discussion and Q&A
description: This is the second part of a debate which took place at the University of Sydney on 31st of March, 2021. I debated Muslim scholar Uthman Badar on the topic 'Is Life Meaningful Without God?' I defended a view of meaning adapted from Susan Wolf in her paper 'Meaningfulness: A Third Dimension of the Good Life'. The discussion focused mostly on the nature of value and meaning in a material world, and how to understand these concepts. The event was hosted by Sydney University Muslim Students' Association (SUMSA).

title: Braxton and Winger's LAST DITCH Effort to Save the Kalam - Unfortunately Bad Defences of the Kalam
description:
Here I review a short video by Mike Winger and Braxton Hunter on atheist objections to the Kalam Cosmological Argument. In particular I discuss the nature of the first cause, theories of causation, agent causation, and methodological naturalism.

54:05 Problems with agent causation

1:18:20 Does the Kalam give you theism?
1:21:25 Now the Kalam gives you Christianity!
1:24:05 'Ruling out' all non-Abrahamic religions
1:30:00 Summary and conclusions

https://www.amazon.com/Unreasonable-Faith-William-Overstates-Christianity/dp/1912701189/

title: Christianity DISPROVED in Somewhat More than 5 minutes - Responding to Habermas on the Resurrection
description:
I respond to a short clip by Dr. Gary Habermas regarding the Historical Facts Argument for the Resurrection of Jesus, by outlining points of disagreement with reference to my Resurrection, Hallucination, Biases, and Socialisation (RHBS) model of the resurrection appearances.

More on my model:
https://thegodlesstheist.com/2017/04/02/the-resurrection-of-jesus-explaining-the-historical-facts-debate-notes/comment-page-1/
My book Unreasonable Faith:
https://www.amazon.com/Unreasonable-Faith-William-Overstates-Christianity/dp/1912701189/

title: Is Nature All There Is? Theism vs Naturalism Debate
description:
A debate held at the University of Melbourne in August 2017 between James Fodor and Leon Di Stefano. The topic was 'is nature all there is?' James defended a reductive naturalist worldview, while Leon defended a version of hylomorphism grounded in Classical Theism.

title: Craig Responds about the Causal Principle - and Fails to Answer the Question!
description:
Here I respond to a recent answer given by William Lane Craig to a question about the causal principle (everything that begins has a cause) asked by Nathan and me in a recent stream about the Kalam Cosmological Argument. I argue that Craig fails to answer the question satisfactorily, and actually raises more problems for his argument.

16:30 Why this matters for the Kalam

28:23 Skepticism about introspection

title: Responding to Digital Gnosis on askcliffe - terrible arguments for Christianity
description:
My thoughts on an interview of Nathan by askcliffe, discussing evidential and philosophical issues related to Christianity and theism. Topics covered include the cosmological argument, fine-tuning, rationality and language, skepticism, existential experiences, the spread of Christianity, and the reliability of the gospels.

NOTE: due to a mistake I made, the audio of the video cuts out around 1:22:00, however shortly after this a listener made me aware of this, and I started to summarise what Stuart, Rob, and Nathan were saying so you should still be able to follow the end part.

title: James Fodor Live Stream
Peer Disagreement
description:
Recorded at Monash University on 21st May 2014

On many important issues of science, philosophy, politics, and religion, equally knowledgeable and intelligent people often disagree with one another. In this presentation I argue that on such matters, it is not epistemically justifiable to hold firmly to the correctness of one‚Äôs opinion, defined as one‚Äôs own subjective evaluation of the evidence. Rather, I argue that one‚Äôs opinion should receive no greater weight in constituting beliefs than does the opinion of any other equally informed person. I conclude by considering some common objections to my argument.

title: Dr Steel Singularity Music Video
description:
I made this music video to accompany Doctor Steel's excellent song 'The Singularity'. Note that most of the clips in the video are demonstrations of real technologies, which can be found on youtube. There are also some animations of technologies that are currently in development (e.g. fusion and genetic engineering). I think the only part of the video that is pure science fiction at the moment the the part with nanomachines interacting with a cell. The rest is here, now. The singularity is near.

The curve's begun
Nanotechnology transcending biology
This is how the race is won
By my hands the sons of man

Modern technology

Bring on the Singularity

So bring on the knee of the curve
And let's transcend biology
Our archaic humanity

Bring on the Singularity

Bring on the Singularity
Bring on the Singularity
Transcend
Transcend biology
Bring on the Singularity

Transcend biology

title: Learn the Periodic Table Song - All Elements in Order
description:
I created this video as a means to memorize the order of the elements in the periodic table. The song is inspired by Tom Lehrer's famous rendition in 'The Elements', but the trouble with his song is the element's aren't in order, so its not much use for memorisation. Be sure to check out www.periodictable.com for more great images of all the elements. Find the original instrumental music at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YnhmOvXxUYU. 

An mp3 version of the song is avaliable here: http://www.archive.org/details/ThePeriodicTableSong

If you are interested in science check out my podcast:
